line_1: Here the pleas'd Youth his charming Prey secures,
line_2: And round his Pris'ner shut the plated Doors;
But know, tho' All agree the Picture's yours,

line_1: While She her Young from dreaded Harm secures.
line_2: But the Sea-Dog uncommon Toil endures,

line_1: To gain this Fair who still her Heart secures,
line_2: Unmov'd she stands, slights all their soft Amours,

line_1: To gain this Fair who still her Heart secures,
line_2: What would you give the Scene of Love were yours?

line_1: He talks of Conscience, which good men secures
line_2: From all those evil moments guilt endures,

line_1: By Right Divine his lawful Claim secures:
line_2: The Dauphin, first of Men, already's yours,
In every change, both mine and your's.
His Rails, his Windows, and his Doors,

line_1: Which Science from the waste of Time secures,
line_2: But lasting traces mark the happier hours,

line_1: Your Beauty, Nymph, said I, my Faith secures;
line_2: Those you once conquer, must be always yours:
